bibl.title: Ferdinand Marino and Carolina B. Marino v. D. H. McCalla. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Divison

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
FERDIKAND MARINO and CAROLINA BELUSCIA MARINO, his wife, Petitioners, vs. D.H. McCALLA, Defendant.
div1.p: The petitioners herein having on the 31st day of December, A. D. 1902, filed in this court their petition alleging that they were entitled to the custody of one Joseph Marino, a minor, and the son of siad Ferdinand Marino and Carolina Beluscia Marino, and further alleging that said Joseph Marino was unlawfully restrained of his liberty and detained from their custody by D. H. McCalla as commanding officer of the United States' Steamship Wisconsin, and the court, on said date, having ordered a writ of habeas corpus to issue to the said D. H. McCalla, or such other person or officer as might be in charge or command of said steamship Wisconsin, directing the production of the body of said Joseph Marino before said court of the fifth day of January, A. D. 1903; and said writ having been duly served upon Captain Mayo the commanding officer of said steamship Wisconsin, and said Captain Mayo, in obedience to said writ, having on the fifth day of January, 1903, produced the body of said Joseph Marino before this court and made his return to said writ showing by what authority he claimed to detain said Joseph Marino from the custody of the petitioners herein, and the court having heard and considered the evidence in said cause and the petition of the petitioners, and ther return of said Mayo, and being now fully advised in the premises, find-

That the petitioners herein are the parents of the said Joseph Marino; that said Joseph Marino is a minor and the petitioners are entitled to the custody of said minor; that the pretended enlistment of said Joseph Marino in the United States' Navy, set up in the return herein, is voidable at the instance of said petitioners, and the petitioners have taken the proper course to avoid the same, and that said enlistment should be cancelled;

IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that said Joseph Marino be, and he hereby is, discharged from the custody of said Captain Mayo and of the naval authorities of the United States, and custody of the person of said minor is given to the petitioners herein, Ferdinand Marino and Carolina Beluscia Marino.
Done in open court this 5th day of January, A. D. 1902.
div1.ab: In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES District of Washington, Northern Division

Ferdinand Marino and Carolina Beluscia Marino, Petitioner
vs.
D. H. McCalla Defendant

Filed this 6th day of January 1903
A Reeves Ayres Clerk By A. N. Moore. Deputy
ROOM . 304 PIONEER BLOCK Corner First Ave. and James St., - SEATTLE WASH.
